history.content:
Hopefully I can shed some light on this situation :)

Currently I'm a TA for 61B, but this past summer I TA'd for 61BL. The summer before (2015), I took 61BL as a student after dropping 61B the previous spring with Hug about a month in.

If you ask me, 61BL is the best structured CS course at Berkeley, and if it weren't for the logistic nightmare with 1300+ students in the normal semester, I would be a vocal supporter of always running 61BL instead of 61B. 

Your guess about the class structure is correct. There is a lecture every week, usually ~30% review of the first two labs of the week and ~70% prep for the next two labs; the other four days you spend in lab.

In lab, the TA will usually give a brief mini-lecture over the day's topic (about an hour), followed by two hours where you get to solidify the concepts by implementing them. The labs are much longer and more structured than in the normal semester, and they do a good job of teaching the material independently from the TA.

In terms of prep for interviews, I've heard some say that 61BL students are better coders, whereas 61B students have a better conceptual grasp of the material.

On my part, I would definitely say I think the 12 hours+ a week of lab coding in 61BL (not to mention projects) tends to strengthen coding skills more than 61B, but I haven't noticed that 61BL students have a deficiency in conceptual grasp of the material.

It would probably be good to hear from some other past 61BL students as well (who aren't as crazy about the course as I am), but I'll say that overall I think 61BL is one of the best courses at Berkeley, and if you're considering it I would definitely recommend. In the interest of succinctness, here is my (very subjective) tl;dr:

61BL Pros:

  • Much easier to get individual attention (12 hours/week with the same TA who you get to know well, only ~30 people per lab)
  • You get much more practice coding, since you implement (in one form or another) basically everything you learn about
  • One less project! (Classic TA move: I almost put this in the Cons section)
  • The lecturers this next summer are super experienced 61B TAs who are going to do an amazing job.

61BL Cons:

  • The summer goes by fast, and 61B(L) is a hard course. Definitely should be your only priority, and expect it to take a lot of time.
  • Though you will have daily mini-lectures, you will for sure be expected to learn more independently than the normal semester.
  • There are daily quizzes: 100% not meant to be stressful and only to test whether a student is keeping up. If you're the type of student who binge watches lectures in chunks rather than as they come out, you might struggle with the quizzes. Otherwise they tend to be straightforward.

---

Was a student this summer for 61BL. Super enjoyable class. I LA'd the Fall after and am currently a tutor; I think the two classes match up well conceptually, and I definitely preferred learning through labs as opposed through lecture (I have yet to find any 61A/B lecture that is useful enough to the point of overtaking hard practice/coding/questions). Be warned though, it can definitely get stressful over the summer, and the grind of 3-5+ hours a day, sometimes more during project weeks, spent in the same lab can get to you.

Hopefully I can shed some light on this situation :)

children.subject: I am one of the instructors for the summer. We will not be allowing any students to be taking it remotely. Physically being in the lab with the other students is an integral part of CS61BL. Additionally, quizzes must be taken in lab. They will not be administered online at all.

I am looking to take CS 61BL this summer. I am completely ok with the time commitment, but can this class taken "remotely"? That's what I have been doing for CS 61A, although I understand CS 61B will be a harder class. I will only show up for the midterms and final because I have an internship in LA. I read that there will be daily quizzes, are they in-class quizzes or online quizzes? Would it differ by different professors?
You may assuming that section has space. However you must always go to that lab for the summer. Partners must be in the lab section you go to
I was wondering for summer 61BL, are we allowed to attend the lab that we're not enrolled in and be partner with students not in the same lab?

history.content: I took CS 61A last semester and I am taking CS 70 this semester. I really love Josh Hug's lecture style but because I made some big mistakes in CS 61B midterm 1, I have to drop it. I am now deciding between taking CS 61BL during summer or CS 61B next fall. I noticed that CS 61BL has only one lecture but four labs per week, which is very different from CS 61B during regular semester. Does it mean that the lecture in CS 61BL only covers a few things and we will almost learn entire things in labs by ourselves? Can someone who has taken CS 61BL before share the viewpoint on how CS 61BL goes during summer and whether it is a good decision to take it? Since CS 61B is a very important course for future technical interview, I am quite worried about the summer version of it.
history.subject: CS 61BL compared to normal CS 61B?
